text: Arachnothryx is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It contains about 107 species. It is found from Mexico to Peru and in Trinidad. ==Taxonomy== Arachnothryx was named by Jules Émile Planchon in 1849.Arachnothryx In: International Plant Names Index. (see External links below).Jules Émile Planchon. 1849. Flore des Serres et des Jardins de l'Europe 5:442 and illustration. (see External links below). This generic name is derived from Ancient Greek: arachne or arachnos, "a spider", and thrix or trichos, "hair". As currently circumscribed, Arachnothryx is paraphyletic over Cuatrecasasiodendron, Gonzalagunia, and Javorkaea. Some authors have included these genera in a broadly defined Rondeletia, but molecular phylogenetic studies have shown that they are more closely related to Guettarda than to Rondeletia. ==Species== * Arachnothryx aspera (Standl.)
